result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge  to be paid at times and increments as directed by agent
--to pay $33 in subpoena fees

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  as recommended by the agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as the agent may determine is necessary 
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--drug testing at the discretion of the agent 
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee
The Court informs Mr. Hoffman he can request expungement of the DNA sample on file by writing the DOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A Hoffman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of 3-24-16 Sentencing After Revocation (Prison)

IT IS ORDERED that the DOC will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by DOC Records office staff and will be based upon actual release date

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua A Hoffman
Current: PO BOX 36, DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER, Winnebago, WI 54985 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2016)
Prior: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States
to convert time from confinement to Extended Supervision

Case called at 10:46am [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Counsel verifies receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant packet
--no factual corrections to be made

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Hoffman

The Court sentences Mr. Hoffman  to  27  months of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 12 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  91   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--as set forth by DOC as deemed appropriate, to include to pay outstanding court obligations.

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess:  11:20am
Attorney Hagemann
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-24-2016 10:00 am

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Letters of support submitted over the bench

Case called at 10:31am [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance 

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ 
recess: 10:39am--reconvene:10:49am [to allow the Court time to read letters submitted on behalf of Mr. Hoffman]

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
Statement made by Mr. Hoffman

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment as recommended by the agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as the agent may determine is necessary 
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--drug testing at the discretion of the agent 
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge to be paid at times and increments as directed by agent
--to pay $33 in subpoena fees
--to pay $25 in drug testing fees

The Court informs Mr. Hoffman he can request expungement of the DNA sample on file by writing the DOC. 
Days credit for time already served:  21  days
recess: 11:15am
Sentencing hearing on May 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling notice
Letter submitted by non-party in support of the defendant
With criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:35am [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Atty. De La Rosa requests a later date for sentencing
No objection from the State
The Court continues bond 
The Court notes that it has read the statement of Todd Haberkorn
The Court has colloquy with Mr. Hoffman about his in-patient treatment. 
recess:11:48am

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing: May 11, 2015 at 10:30am

Case called at 10:33am {MO]
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court adopts the State's proposed verdict form

The Notice to Admit Statements:
--The Defense had no objections
--The Court grants the Motion to admit the statements of the defendant

State's Motion to Impeach 
--No arguments made
--The Court finds that the Defendant has 2 prior convictions for impeachment purposes.


State's Response to Courts Scheduling Order
--No Objections

The Court will not have an alternative and will have 12 jurors, each party is entitled to 4 strikes.
ADA Shock anticipates a one day jury trial length. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court will allow juror notetakeing and the Court will allow the jurors to asks questions of witnesses under Wis JI Criminal 57
Counsel indicates they are not anticipating any request for individual voir dire, or for the Court to ask questions other than those set forth in Special Materials. 
The Court informs counsel that it intends to give the burden of proof, presumption of innocence, and substantive jury instructions during jury selection process.
recess:10:45am

NEXT: The 3/23/15 FSSC and the 3/26-3/27 Jury Trial remain on the calendar
States proposed verdict form
Motion hearing on March 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant, State's (with cover letter)
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
State's Response to Court's Scheduling Order; with cover letter
State's, with cover letter
Scheduling order
Jury trial on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on March 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 8:53 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent. 
Mr. Hoffman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
off-record: 8:57 - 8:59 am for scheduling
Court announces dates for the record; Court orders: all motions filed 30 days before FSSC - Any motion is to be scheduled to be heard no later than10 days prior to FSSC. For any motion filed, the opposing party should file response no later than 5 days prior to motion hrg. date. All jury instructions to be filed 30 days before FSSC, to include instruction on charged count, including deviation in language being identified with argument/authority for the deviation. All substantive instructions also due 30 days before FSSC in final form. By list only (title & instruction #) all standard instructions. Verdict forms shall be submitted infinal form along with instructions. Parties will also advise the Court re: questions from the jury, size of jury. Any special requests of voir dire also due at this time if beyond usual scope. 
Recess: 9:04 am 

NEXT: (1)  FSSC scheduled for 3/23/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices (3) JT scheduled for 3/26-27/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
States demand w/cover letter
Defendant's
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 7, 2015 at 11:20 am.
Probable Cause Statement
Scheduling Notice
original bond document received from JESO on 12/4/14

Case called at 1:27 pm
Defendant Joshua A Hoffman in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maitain Absolute Sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia to include syringes unless prescribed for a prescription medication

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:32 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
PTC: 1/7/15 at 11:20 am
